newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Globe, VDigitel in telephone pact.
newsitem.headline: Globe, VDigitel in telephone pact.

text.p: Globe Telecom said on Wednesday it has signed an interconnection agreement with Digital Telecommunications Philippines Inc (Digitel) linking their telephone networks.
In a press statement, Globe said the deal will allow subscribers of both companies to call each other directly.
Globe has the mandate to install telephone lines in the financial district of Makati and other areas. It is a joint venture company of Ayala Corp and Singapore Telecommunications Ltd..
Digitel, on the other hand, provides fixed line telecommunication services in the northern island of Luzon except for Metro Manila. Digitel is a unit of JG Summit Holdings.
Local telecommunication laws require interconnection among carriers.
